Recipe.title: Cheesy Salsa Dip
Recipe.Source: From the kitchen of a random friend at a party
Recipe.Description:
Corn chips are pretty boring by themselves. They are great with salsa, but after a while, even that gets old. We have purchased all sorts of dips, such as nacho cheese, for corn chips, but nothing really had that "wow" we wanted.
Then, at a party, we tried a dip that really impressed us. We asked around and found out it was "homemade" and we coaxed the recipe out of them.

section.instruction: Heat the Cheese in the microwave oven for 30 seconds.
Repeat steps 1 and 2 until the Cheese is melted.
Heat in microwave oven for 30 seconds.
Repeat steps 5 and 6 until mixture is smooth.

Notes.note: Do not use Plain Cheese, such as Cheddar. It turns into a glob instead of a spread.
Do not use Nacho Cheese. It turns into a soup instead of a spread.
Chunky salsa is usually more appealing.
You can use Mild, Medium, or Hot Salsa, depending on your preference.
